00030 #ifndef _GNU_SOURCE
00031 #define _GNU_SOURCE

00034 #include <stdio.h>
00035 #include <stdint.h>
00036 #include <stdlib.h>
00037 #include <unistd.h>
00038 #include <errno.h>
00039 #include <fcntl.h>
00040 #include <string.h>
00041 #include <mntent.h>
00042 #include <linux/unistd.h>
00043 #include <sys/stat.h>
00044 #include <sys/syscall.h>
00045 
00046 #include <lustre/lustre_user.h>
00047 
00048 #define MAX_HANDLE_SZ 128
00049 
00050 #if !defined(HAVE_FHANDLE_GLIBC_SUPPORT) && defined(HAVE_FHANDLE_SYSCALLS)
00051 /* Because the kernel supports this functions doesn't mean that glibc does.
00052  * Just in case we define what we need */
00053 struct file_handle {
00054         __u32 handle_bytes;
00055         int handle_type;
00056         /* file identifier */
00057         unsigned char f_handle[0];
00058 };
00059 
00060 #if defined(_ASM_X86_UNISTD_64_H)
00061 
00062 #ifndef __NR_name_to_handle_at
00063 #define __NR_name_to_handle_at 303
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 #ifndef __NR_open_by_handle_at
00067 #define __NR_open_by_handle_at 304
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 #elif defined(_ASM_X86_UNISTD_32_H)
00071 
00072 #ifndef __NR_name_to_handle_at
00073 #define __NR_name_to_handle_at 341
00074 #endif
00075 
00076 #ifndef __NR_open_by_handle_at
00077 #define __NR_open_by_handle_at 342
00078 #endif
00079 
00080 #else
00081 
00082 #ifndef __NR_name_to_handle_at
00083 #define __NR_name_to_handle_at 264
00084 #endif
00085 
00086 #ifndef __NR_open_by_handle_at
00087 #define __NR_open_by_handle_at 265
00088 #endif
00089 
00090 
00091 #endif
00092 
00093 static inline int
00094 name_to_handle_at(int mnt_fd, const char *filename, struct file_handle *fh,
00095                   int *mnt_id, int flags)
00096 {
00097         return syscall(__NR_name_to_handle_at, mnt_fd, filename, fh,
00098                        &mnt_id, flags);
00099 }
00100 
00101 static inline int
00102 open_by_handle_at(int mnt_fd, struct file_handle *fh, int mode)
00103 {
00104         return syscall(__NR_open_by_handle_at, mnt_fd, fh, mode);
00105 }
00106 #endif
00107 
00108 void usage(char *prog)
00109 {
00110         fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s <filepath>\n",
00111                 prog);
00112         fprintf(stderr, "the absolute path of a test file on a "
00113                 "lustre file system is needed.\n");
00114         exit(1);
00115 }
00116 
00117 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00118 {
00119 #ifdef HAVE_FHANDLE_SYSCALLS
00120         char *filename, *file, *mount_point = NULL, *readbuf = NULL;
00121         int ret, rc = -EINVAL, mnt_id, mnt_fd, fd1, fd2, i, len, offset;
00122         struct file_handle *fh = NULL;
00123         int file_size, mtime, ctime;
00124         struct lu_fid *parent, *fid;
00125         struct mntent *ent;
00126         struct stat st;
00127         __ino_t inode;
00128         FILE *mntpt;
00129 
00130         if (argc != 2)
00131                 usage(argv[0]);
00132 
00133         file = argv[1];
00134         if (file[0] != '/') {
00135                 fprintf(stderr, "Need the absolete path of the file\n");
00136                 goto out;
00137         }
00138 
00139         fd1 = open(file, O_RDONLY);
00140         if (fd1 < 0) {
00141                 fprintf(stderr, "open file %s error: %s\n",
00142                         file, strerror(errno));
00143                 rc = errno;
00144                 goto out;
00145         }
00146 
00147         /* Get file stats using fd1 from traditional open */
00148         bzero(&st, sizeof(struct stat));
00149         rc = fstat(fd1, &st);
00150         if (rc < 0) {
00151                 fprintf(stderr, "fstat(%s) error: %s\n", file,
00152                         strerror(errno));
00153                 rc = errno;
00154                 goto out_fd1;
00155         }
00156 
00157         inode = st.st_ino;
00158         mtime = st.st_mtime;
00159         ctime = st.st_ctime;
00160         file_size = st.st_size;
00161 
00162         /* Now for the setup to use fhandles */
00163         mntpt = setmntent("/etc/mtab", "r");
00164         if (mntpt == NULL) {
00165                 fprintf(stderr, "setmntent error: %s\n",
00166                         strerror(errno));
00167                 rc = errno;
00168                 goto out_fd1;
00169         }
00170 
00171         while (NULL != (ent = getmntent(mntpt))) {
00172                 if ((strncmp(file, ent->mnt_dir, strlen(ent->mnt_dir)) == 0) &&
00173                     (strcmp(ent->mnt_type, "lustre") == 0)) {
00174                         mount_point = ent->mnt_dir;
00175                         break;
00176                 }
00177         }
00178         endmntent(mntpt);
00179 
00180         if (mount_point == NULL) {
00181                 fprintf(stderr, "file is not located on a lustre file "
00182                         "system?\n");
00183                 goto out_fd1;
00184         }
00185 
00186         filename = rindex(file, '/') + 1;
00187 
00188         /* Open mount point directory */
00189         mnt_fd = open(mount_point, O_DIRECTORY);
00190         if (mnt_fd < 0) {
00191                 fprintf(stderr, "open(%s) error: %s\n)", mount_point,
00192                         strerror(errno));
00193                 rc = errno;
00194                 goto out_fd1;
00195         }
00196 
00197         /* Allocate memory for file handle */
00198         fh = malloc(sizeof(struct file_handle) + MAX_HANDLE_SZ);
00199         if (!fh) {
00200                 fprintf(stderr, "malloc(%d) error: %s\n", MAX_HANDLE_SZ,
00201                         strerror(errno));
00202                 rc = errno;
00203                 goto out_mnt_fd;
00204         }
00205         fh->handle_bytes = MAX_HANDLE_SZ;
00206 
00207         /* Convert name to handle */
00208         ret = name_to_handle_at(mnt_fd, filename, fh, &mnt_id,
00209                                 AT_SYMLINK_FOLLOW);
00210         if (ret) {
00211                 fprintf(stderr, "name_by_handle_at(%s) error: %s\n", filename,
00212                         strerror(errno));
00213                 rc = errno;
00214                 goto out_f_handle;
00215         }
00216 
00217         /* Print out the contents of the file handle */
00218         fprintf(stdout, "fh_bytes: %u\nfh_type: %d\nfh_data: ",
00219                 fh->handle_bytes, fh->handle_type);
00220         for (i = 0; i < fh->handle_bytes; i++)
00221                 fprintf(stdout, "%02x ", fh->f_handle[i]);
00222         fprintf(stdout, "\n");
00223 
00224         /* Lustre stores both the parents FID and the file FID
00225          * in the f_handle. */
00226         parent = (struct lu_fid *)(fh->f_handle + 16);
00227         fid = (struct lu_fid *)fh->f_handle;
00228         fprintf(stdout, "file's parent FID is "DFID"\n", PFID(parent));
00229         fprintf(stdout, "file FID is "DFID"\n", PFID(fid));
00230 
00231         /* Open the file handle */
00232         fd2 = open_by_handle_at(mnt_fd, fh, O_RDONLY);
00233         if (fd2 < 0) {
00234                 fprintf(stderr, "open_by_handle_at(%s) error: %s\n", filename,
00235                         strerror(errno));
00236                 rc = errno;
00237                 goto out_f_handle;
00238         }
00239 
00240         /* Get file size */
00241         bzero(&st, sizeof(struct stat));
00242         rc = fstat(fd2, &st);
00243         if (rc < 0) {
00244                 fprintf(stderr, "fstat(%s) error: %s\n", filename,
00245                         strerror(errno));
00246                 rc = errno;
00247                 goto out_fd2;
00248         }
00249 
00250         if (ctime != st.st_ctime || file_size != st.st_size ||
00251             inode != st.st_ino || mtime != st.st_mtime) {
00252                 fprintf(stderr, "stat data does not match between fopen "
00253                         "and fhandle case\n");
00254                 goto out_fd2;
00255         }
00256 
00257         if (st.st_size) {
00258                 len = st.st_blksize;
00259                 readbuf = malloc(len);
00260                 if (readbuf == NULL) {
00261                         fprintf(stderr, "malloc(%d) error: %s\n", len,
00262                                 strerror(errno));
00263                         rc = errno;
00264                         goto out_fd2;
00265                 }
00266 
00267                 for (offset = 0; offset < st.st_size; offset += len) {
00268                         /* read from the file */
00269                         rc = read(fd2, readbuf, len);
00270                         if (rc < 0) {
00271                                 fprintf(stderr, "read(%s) error: %s\n",
00272                                         filename, strerror(errno));
00273                                 rc = errno;
00274                                 goto out_readbuf;
00275                         }
00276                 }
00277         }
00278 
00279         rc = 0;
00280         fprintf(stdout, "check_fhandle_syscalls test Passed!\n");
00281 
00282 out_readbuf:
00283         if (readbuf != NULL)
00284                 free(readbuf);
00285 out_fd2:
00286         close(fd2);
00287 out_f_handle:
00288         free(fh);
00289 out_mnt_fd:
00290         close(mnt_fd);
00291 out_fd1:
00292         close(fd1);
00293 out:
00294         return rc;
00295 #else /* !HAVE_FHANDLE_SYSCALLS */
00296         if (argc != 2)
00297                 usage(argv[0]);
00298 
00299         fprintf(stderr, "HAVE_FHANDLE_SYSCALLS not defined\n");
00300         return 0;
00301 #endif /* HAVE_FHANDLE_SYSCALLS */
00302 }
